summary: Ophiuchus is a large constellation that sits on the celestial equator. Its name means "serpent-bearer" in Ancient Greek, and it's often shown as a person holding a snake. The snake is the constellation Serpens. Ophiuchus was first listed by astronomer Ptolemy in the 2nd century and is still one of the 88 modern constellations. It used to be called Serpentarius.
title: Ophiuchus
